channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: DHS funding battle risks shutdown. And, Fed holds rates steady despite Trump pressure
item.description: Senate Democrats threaten a partial government shutdown over DHS funding. And, the Fed defies President Trump's pressure and holds rates steady to fight inflation.
item.content:encoded:
Senate Democrats threaten a partial government shutdown over DHS funding. And, the Fed defies President Trump's pressure and holds rates steady to fight inflation.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Saying Minnesota has 'been through a lot,' Klobuchar announces bid for governor
item.description: Democratic Sen. Amy Klobuchar announced her run for Minnesota governor early Thursday. There is already a crowded field of Republicans in a race where immigration enforcement has become a key issue.
item.content:encoded:
Democratic Sen. Amy Klobuchar announced her run for Minnesota governor early Thursday. There is already a crowded field of Republicans in a race where immigration enforcement has become a key issue.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Ellie Roth

item.title: Senegal and Morocco fined and players banned after African Cup final chaos
item.description: Africa's soccer body issued fines worth more than $1 million and banned Senegal's coach and Senegalese and Morocco players Wednesday following a shambolic African Cup soccer final this month.
item.content:encoded:
Africa's soccer body issued fines worth more than $1 million and banned Senegal's coach and Senegalese and Morocco players Wednesday following a shambolic African Cup soccer final this month.

(Image credit: Youssef Loulidi)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump has sued universities for billions. Here's what the strategy tells us
item.description: Each deal between colleges and the administration is unique, but they have common goals: altering the culture at powerful institutions and making their policies more aligned with President Trump's.
item.content:encoded:
Each deal between colleges and the administration is unique, but they have common goals: altering the culture at powerful institutions and making their policies more aligned with President Trump's.

(Image credit: Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: 'Philadelphia,' 'Clueless,' 'The Karate Kid' added to the National Film Registry
item.description: Every year, the National Film Registry adds 25 films to its collection to be preserved for posterity. Selections for 2025 ranges from 'The Thing' to 'White Christmas'
item.content:encoded: Every year, the National Film Registry adds 25 films to its collection to be preserved for posterity. Selections for 2025 ranges from 'The Thing' to 'White Christmas'
item.dc:creator: Neda Ulaby

item.title: Big budget Melania Trump documentary premieres with splashy rollout
item.description: A film about first lady Melania Trump premieres this week, with big presidential promotion.
item.content:encoded:
A film about first lady Melania Trump premieres this week, with big presidential promotion.

(Image credit: Michael Nagle)
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: Caregivers for the elderly could lose wage protections under Trump proposal
item.description: The Labor Department has proposed rescinding an Obama-era rule that gave home care workers the right to overtime pay and other wage protections. The administration says the rule made care too costly.
item.content:encoded:
The Labor Department has proposed rescinding an Obama-era rule that gave home care workers the right to overtime pay and other wage protections. The administration says the rule made care too costly.

(Image credit: Frazao Studio Latino)
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: Car rams into Chabad headquarters in New York City, damaging doors
item.description: A man was arrested after repeatedly crashing his car into the Chabad Lubavitch world headquarters in New York City on Wednesday night while people were gathered for prayer.
item.content:encoded:
A man was arrested after repeatedly crashing his car into the Chabad Lubavitch world headquarters in New York City on Wednesday night while people were gathered for prayer.

(Image credit: Mark Lennihan)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Starmer and Xi call for deeper UK-China ties as Trump shakes up global relations
item.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer and Chinese leader Xi Jinping in Beijing called for a "comprehensive strategic partnership" to deepen ties amid global uncertainty.
item.content:encoded:
British Prime Minister Keir Starmer and Chinese leader Xi Jinping in Beijing called for a "comprehensive strategic partnership" to deepen ties amid global uncertainty.

(Image credit: Carl Court)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: How the Minneapolis killings look from Trump country
item.description: The shooting of Alex Pretti and Renee Macklin Good by federal agents in Minneapolis have enraged many people across the country. NPR wanted to know what supporters of President Trump's immigration policy think about the shootings.
item.content:encoded:
The shooting of Alex Pretti and Renee Macklin Good by federal agents in Minneapolis have enraged many people across the country. NPR wanted to know what supporters of President Trump's immigration policy think about the shootings.

(Image credit: Adam Gray)
item.dc:creator: Frank Langfitt
